title.label: Recent update causing balls to stop abruptly

content.label: Been playing for years but only recently a few days ago I‚Äôm seeing balls just abruptly stop, and it‚Äôs a glitch that‚Äôs happening on the regular. Also, did the ball sizes slightly increase also? Something seems slightly off with the gameplay...please help thank you!

Lately I‚Äôve noticed that after the break, there is a hesitation in the movement of the balls. It‚Äôs like it freezes up for a millisecond then the balls start rolling again. This happened only after I hit a perfect score on standard run. Coincidence or is there something wrong with the game? I shut down and restarted my IPad, to no avail. Please help as I love this game but becoming disillusioned with it.

Poor control and game mechanics. Only straight shots as the balls barely move anywhere. It lies a lot. ‚Äú3 games until the next commercial‚Äù. Then one game and it says the same thing. The whole concept with the moving multipliers is dumb. It‚Äôs not like pool at all really.

title.label: Kills Battery!  Needs an update maybe?

content.label: Played for 23 minutes and that caused 16% of my battery consumption for the past 24 hours!  Brand new iPhone 11Pro.  Maybe this game has a problem with iOS 13?  Please fix it!  (Unfortunately I saw the stats *after* I paid for the game!)
Using iPhone 11 Pro - game is full of jitter and makes its virtually unplayable. Desperately in need of an update as the last update was 11 months ago.

I like the concept of this game, sinking balls into differently valued pockets that change between successful turns. However there are several issues. Biggest of all is that something in this game is coded so portly my phone gets EXTREMELY hot after just a few minutes of play. For gameplay there is no control over where you strike the cue ball so you cannot use any spin or English in order to gain a better position on the next shot. The controls for how hard you strike the ball are also very poor. Lastly, the interface is not very good, but is minor compared to the other issues. I‚Äôm left a bit perplexed as to how this game was featured in an App Store story.
I wanted to try this game but it just crashes before getting past the initial screen. ‚òπÔ∏è
Idk why but the q-ball loses half its speed for no reason

title.label: Amazingly addictive but now painfully laggy

content.label: Love the game but the latest release has some kind of nasty memory leak that makes it almost unplayable.  The lag (on a brand new iPhone 11) started on my iPhone 10 and is present on the new device with the latest iOS.  Would have given it five stars (and will if it‚Äôs fixed) but for now it is unplayable and unfun.

If you just want to pot balls, go right ahead. The scoring system for the challenges is just about the most inept thing I‚Äôve ever seen. You can play PERFECTLY and still lose all your ‚Äúcash‚Äù because of the stupid multiplier that multiples your score by ZERO and takes all your ‚Äúmoney‚Äù which you then have to rebuy. It‚Äôs a con. What a stupid stupid concept.
Why does a game with 14 dots on a static background lag all the time? Ruins games constantly.
This game is barebones. The maker thinks he is entitled to ads. I think not. First ad = app removed.
Overdue for an update. Pretty much unplayable in iOS 13.
Why does this game run so terribly slow on iPhone 11 with iOS 13?

I have never played a game that frustrated me as much as this one. On several occasions I nearly threw my phone across the room in response to this ‚Äúgame.‚Äù The precision is very limited. The tournament game modes overly punish players. The physics is bizarre. I am truly sorry I paid for this game. The only positive is the background music.

Sept 2019 update: 
This game performs terribly on iPhone 11 pro. Low frame rate, that drops even more when multiple balls are moving on-screen. Hope they fix this. 

Original review: 
I really like the gameplay. The physics feel real enough. The pocket-scoring mechanic keeps it interesting. The game has plenty of modes to enjoy. 

But there are some bugs that, while rare, can kill your game. This is especially true if you‚Äôre playing in ‚ÄúHigh stakes‚Äùmode and have bet the farm you‚Äôll win. 

A few times I‚Äôve encountered bugs like the target ball being a phantom, where the cue goes right through it. Other times the target ball is fixed to the table, so the cue just bounces off. I‚Äôve also had a few instances of the ‚Äúgame over‚Äù screen coming on, only to watch the ball drop into the pocket moments later. Again these are rare, but crop up consistently. 

I‚Äôve been hoping an update would fix these bugs, but so far that hasn‚Äôt happened. Also, $20 to unlock unlimited ‚Äúhigh stakes‚Äù play on top of the ad-free purchase is a bit much.

title.label: Latest iOS update has rendered this once amazing game useless.

content.label: Latest iOS update has rendered this once amazing game useless.  The game runs with extreme lag and is impossible to navigate or play. Please update!

title.label: Ads are often, crazy-long and auto redirect to app store!

content.label: Zero stars. Ad are waaaay tooooo long, with no way to "x" out AND they automatically auto-redirect to @AppleAppStore. Every time!!!!!!. Must flag!!!!! report to @AppleAppStore to take down game ASAP!

So basically I love the game! It has 3 modes really....Standard, High Stakes and, Insta-Tournament. My issue is that High Stakes has a challenge called Crazy 8 where all balls are 8 balls. It‚Äôs actually really fun except when make a ball the hole multipliers randomly changes. Let‚Äôs say your ‚ÄúAll in‚Äù and you get 2:45s to complete the match, crazy 8 and, inflate deflate, when you make it the time keeps going while the 8 ball multipliers are spinning. In my mind I think this is unfair cause we can‚Äôt speed that up or slow it down. There‚Äôs two ways it can be fix stop the timer keep when the animation is playing or get rid of the animation and automatically change the multipliers. It‚Äôs just annoying when you loose all your coins for something like that. 

P.S.
Having a big a*s timer on board blocks some shots and is unnecessary.

P.P.S.
I still think it‚Äôs worth the download!
Don‚Äôt say the ads will be every 3 games if you play them after every single game
THE BALLS BOUNCE RIGHT OUT OF THE HOLES EVEN WHEN YOU HIT THEM PERFECTLY IN THE POCKET. THANKS FOR NOTHING

I love the game it is creative and and like the graphics. It is simple and anyone who like pool üé± can love the game.

But the only problem is that if you have no more coins for the high stake pool üé± and if you don‚Äôt want to waste money to get more then the only way to get the coins back is to delete and redownload the game (I think) So developer, can you make that we can get coins by watching a short ad (PLEASE) 

Thanks for taking the time to read my looooooooooong review !
I hope ü§û you enjoy your life 

                             From someone 
                             To the developer

The key to this game are the ‚Äúconditions‚Äù. Some are easy. But most are difficult.

You spin for a condition. If you don‚Äôt like the condition you get, you can spin again. But that will cost you.

And that‚Äôs where the game is rigged. When you spin again, very often you‚Äôll get that exact same difficult condition again! Spin and get Cuewall (a difficult condition). Spin again, and get Cuewall again.

I‚Äôve played about 30 games so far. And I‚Äôve already spun Cuewall three times in a row, twice. What are the chances of that happening randomly, even once? It‚Äôs very low. Maybe it‚Äôs 1 in 1000. But it‚Äôs happened twice for me. So either I‚Äôm the unluckiest person in the world, or this game is rigged.

The game evidently forces the more difficult conditions on you. That way, you‚Äôll lose more frequently. And then the developer hopes you‚Äôll spend money for a rebuy.

And that‚Äôs a pity. The idea behind this game is great. Rigging the conditions, that‚Äôs not so great.

On edit: 
I‚Äôve played about 20 more games. It‚Äôs almost amusing to try to predict what rigged ‚Äúcondition‚Äù will come up next. I‚Äôll spin for a condition. Almost always, a difficult one will come up. It could be Perfect Run or Cuewall, for example. (An easy condition, like Inflate/Deflate, that you will almost never see.) So I spin again. Again, it‚Äôs almost always one of the more difficult conditions. What fun!

Ran up 2.3 BN points over time, then the screen froze on ‚ÄúHigh Stakes.‚Äù I had to uninstall/reinstall to return to game...voila, no points for me. Alas, my fortune is no more but I have broken my addiction.
Just got it and I already love it. Plz play this game it‚Äôs a blast!

I like this a lot. It lets you play against yourself. Not a lot of intrusive ads and popups. The speed needs tweaking, it‚Äôs pretty unreliable. Either that, or the friction on the table is really high. A medium stroke will have the ball stopping without impacting itself before it gets from one side of the table to the other.

title.label: A game for children age 4-8! Boring

content.label:
A game for children age 4-8! And they would get bored after a few games. From the break the balls don‚Äôt behave like a real pool table because they hardly move. 
Please don‚Äôt waste your time and energy...
I previously gave a 3Star review because didn‚Äôt realize there was an ad-free version.  I do now.  Great game; quick to play and very enjoyable.  Yet another Zach Gage classic!

Great app‚Äîintuitive, fun, but challenging. Yes, there are ads, (VERY understandable from the point of view or revenue) but nothing is restricted and the core of the app is gameplay. Keep it up folks!!!! Yeah!

This is definitely a fun Pool game that can be either competitive or relaxing, depending on the mood. However, there are a few things that kept this game from staying on my phone; 
The ‚Äúflick‚Äù motion can definitely be fun, and is more engaging, however it does make it a little harder to gauge your strike speed, and it is extremely unappealing when you have tired or small hands that can‚Äôt make the motion without changing the way the phone is held. I would absolutely love to see a slider option, which would also add to casual appeal. I‚Äôve also noticed that some of the game physics are not entirely correct, that being said the friction is, but the directional displacement can be a little off sometimes. Overall the game is very nice!

title.label: Gameplay is too complicated not fun

content.label:
Even with the tutorial the controls are not intuitive and it takes you so long to line up a shot and then touch it just right to kick it into a pocket that it‚Äôs just really not fun. :(

I deleted after a few tries; it‚Äôs unfortunate because the game had a lot of potential but if you‚Äôre looking for just a simple time waster I‚Äôm not sure this is it.

I want to love this game so much. It‚Äôs fun  and almost perfect. But the controls are so irritating can you please add support to change them in the options or something and I would gladly give this game a 5. It need something more reliable. Less flick, more pull back and let it go at the desired strength I need. Other than that it‚Äôs a great simple arcade pool game that is perfect. Controls just make it unplayable at this point.
The game feels clunky

title.label: Ads shouldn‚Äôt play with volume when the phone is on mute

content.label: Ads should follow the mute button. If my phone is on mute, ads should not play with loud volume. Also the ads lie. It will the next ad won‚Äôt be until 3 more games, but there is always one every single game. Delete.

It‚Äôs all around great, the score system, tournament, and high stakes games are all amazing. The power mechanic is dreadful, though, swiping instead of drawing back like other pool apps, and it really kills the game. It also lacks any English/spin mechanic which is dreadful for setting up shots

title.label: Game is 5 stars, Ads are 1 star

content.label:
Love this game and other games by Gage! Really well done all the way around!

However, many of the ads served automatically play audio regardless of device settings. I almost always play w/ my phone silenced, and suddenly an add will play at full volume. Ads should NEVER be allowed to do this. I‚Äôm deleting because I can‚Äôt trust that it‚Äôll be silent. And who knows what other settings the ads are overriding :-(

title.label: Fun game with lots of flaws

content.label:
The gameplay is fun, the idea is an interesting twist on pool. But there are many issues. 

1) the worst thing is the ads. I don't mind banner ads. But this app has full screen video ads every few games. It's horrible. I can't listen to music while playing this because the ads take over whenever they play. I'd love to get rid of them, but it feels like extortion. If the ads weren't as horrible and intrusive, I'd pay for the full version. But I won't give the dev money for putting horrible ads like the ones in the game. 

2) regarding the actual game, I should be able to undo a move. 

3) I should be able to move my cue ball after a missed shot. I should be able to move it when starting a game too. Unless I can and haven't been able to figure it out. 

4) sometimes feels like the physics are off. Meaning when I shoot a ball off a wall, it doesn't go where it feels like it should.
The mechanics are non consistent and the high stakes mode is highly flawed. Either you have ok odds or it‚Äôs next to impossible and the paid version should have zero ads!!! #ShameOnZachGage
Everything this developer does is so well designed and monetized do fairly. I have four of his games and enjoy them all.

Really love the physics simulation in this game. It captures everything fun about real billiards. The gameplay, however, is lacking one feature that would make it perfect: Undo. With a touch interface it‚Äôs a bit too easy to accidentally trigger a gesture. It would be nice if the app accommodated that by allowing undo.

title.label: What‚Äôs up with the frame rate?

content.label: The frames are horrendous. Stutters every few seconds and overall estimated 15 FPS. I remember this game running much smoother before.

One question - how does one get the view they use in the App Store of being down at the table level instead of the overhead view? I see that and want that view, but can‚Äôt figure out how to get it! Help!

I feel like every game right now is full of ads, and I've made peace with it, the amount of ads isn't the problem. It's that there is a new 30 second ad every single round when it says that the next ad will be shown in 3 rounds. This makes me feel like I'm being lied to and I don't like it.

For the love of God, learn how to code ads from playing at full volume. I used to play your chess game and it blares when ads come up even though my phone is on silent. Now, I have to worry about the same crap in this game. Honestly, the next time I see your name on a game I am avoiding it. You make good games, but not considering the ad volumes makes me super angry. Most of this anger comes from a precious angel that sleeps next to me. When she wakes up, I am public enemy no. 1. Figure it out man.
This game is creative I just love the idea and the execution of the game. Super fun to play

Horrible app for the common pool player. Great app for those who are not good at pool. The mechanics need spin more realistic cushions, and the scoring system is cool be the 740 cap is easy to reach after a few games.
This game really needs a way to remove ads. They're way to obtrusive as is.

I love this app because it realistically lets me try out shots and discover where my ideas don‚Äôt match the realities of physics. Those said physics are pretty well grounded in the game engine and I really enjoy seeing the visual representation of where the target ball will go, given a perfect cue stroke. I enjoy the concept of lining up the results of each shot into a 10 point pocket so that the next shot will also line up with the rotated 10 point pocket (just like real pros are thinking ahead).

However, I don‚Äôt understand the game‚Äôs random actions where the next 10 point pocket is changed from what it should normally be. I‚Äôve tried to match this randomness with the preceding shot (maybe a poor but lucky shot generates this action?) The one other feature I‚Äôd like added, even as a new game mode to keep it from altering the pure skill mode, would be to allow a shot to be replayed. This would give me a better chance to learn to read shot potential better, just like if I were shooting on a real table. 

I‚Äôd love to pay for a no ad version if this mode were added. It would make it a pure 5-star rating!

This game is so understanding. It‚Äôs like, ‚Äúhey sorry to hit you with an ad‚Äù and the ad is so short. It‚Äôs ask your permission to use data analysis, I was skeptical at first, but it‚Äôs seriously just a cool guy, making awesome games. I find myself playing this more than a different 8ball game against others. The idea is just so fun, I plan and try trick shots instead of wan bam I win because I potted more bawlZ than you.

Unless you want to sit through 30+ second ads between EVERY game (even though it says it‚Äôll be 3 games before another, each time) don‚Äôt bother downloading. The game itself is fun but most of the time you‚Äôre not even playing it.
